Package com.authenticket.authenticket.controller

Class AuthenticationController

java.lang.Object
com.authenticket.authenticket.service.Utility
com.authenticket.authenticket.controller.AuthenticationController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins={"${authenticket.frontend-production-url}","${authenticket.frontend-dev-url}","${authenticket.loadbalancer-url}"}, methods={GET,POST}, allowedHeaders={"Authorization","Cache-Control","Content-Type"}, allowCredentials="true") @RequestMapping("/api/v2/auth") public class AuthenticationController extends Utility
This is the authentication controller class and the base path for this controller's endpoint is api/v2/auth.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthenticationController

  • Method Details

    • tokenCheck

      @PostMapping("token-verification") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> tokenCheck(@RequestParam("jwtToken") String token, @RequestParam("userEmail") String userEmail)
      Verify the validity of a JWT token and check if it is associated with a specific user.
      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token to be verified.
      userEmail - The email of the user to which the token should be associated.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a GeneralApiResponse indicating the result of token verification. If the token is valid and associated with the provided user, it returns a success message along with user authorities. If the token is invalid, it returns an error message. If the provided email is not registered, it returns an error message. If the token's signature cannot be trusted, it returns an error message.

    • userRegister

      @PostMapping("/user-register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> userRegister(@RequestParam("name") String name, @RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password, @RequestParam("dateOfBirth") LocalDate dob)
      Register a new user with the provided information.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user to be registered.
      email - The email address of the user to be registered.
      password - The password for the user's account (will be securely hashed and stored).
      dob - The date of birth of the user.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a GeneralApiResponse indicating the success of user registration. The response typically includes a message stating that user verification is required.

    • userConfirm

      @GetMapping(path="/user-register/confirm") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> userConfirm(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestParam("redirect") String redirect)
      Confirm a user's registration using a verification token and redirect to a specified URL. Used in email when a confirmation email is sent to the user's email to verify the user.
      Parameters:
      token - The verification token used to confirm the user's registration.
      redirect - The URL to which the endpoint should redirect after confirmation.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity that typically performs a redirect response to the specified URL if confirmation is successful, or returns an error response with a message if confirmation fails.

    • userAuthenticate

      @PostMapping("/user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> userAuthenticate(@RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password)
      Authenticate a user by their email and password.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to authenticate.
      password - The password of the user for authentication.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a GeneralApiResponse indicating the result of user authentication. If successful, it returns a welcome message, or an error message if authentication fails due to an unregistered email or account lock.

    • orgRegister

      @PostMapping("/org-register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> orgRegister(@RequestParam("name") String name, @RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("description") String description)
      Register a new organization (event organizer) with the provided information.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the organization to be registered.
      email - The email address of the organization.
      description - A description of the organization.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the success of organization registration.

    • eventOrgAuthenticate

      @PostMapping("/org") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> eventOrgAuthenticate(@RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password)
      Authenticate an organization (event organizer) by their email and password.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the organization.
      password - The password for authentication.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the result of organization authentication.

    • adminRegister

      @PostMapping("/admin-register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> adminRegister(@RequestParam("name") String name, @RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password)
      Register a new admin with the provided information.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the admin to be registered.
      email - The email address of the admin.
      password - The password for the admin's account (will be securely hashed and stored).
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the success of admin registration.

    • adminAuthenticate

      @PostMapping("/admin") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<GeneralApiResponse<Object>> adminAuthenticate(@RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password)
      Authenticate an admin by their email and password.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the admin to authenticate.
      password - The password of the admin for authentication.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the result of admin authentication. If successful, it returns a welcome message, or an error message if authentication fails due to an unregistered email or account lock.
